intro: Spartotamnus sessilifolius, commonly known as the sessile-leaf spartotamnus, is a shrub native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southwestern North America. It is characterized by its dense, woody growth and small, narrow leaves that are often clustered near the base of the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by small, dry fruits containing minute seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with limited water availability. Spartotamnus sessilifolius plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
